qas.question: What has been an important atmospheric study since the 1970s?
Where in Antarctica is Halley Station?
When did scientists discover the hole in the ozone layer?
What chemical was discovered to have caused the hole in the ozone?
What agreement banned the use of CFC s?
What was discovered in 1985 in the ozone at the Brunt Station on the Halley Ice Shelf?

plausible_answers.text: ozone layer will return to 1980 levels

qas.question: What will happen to the ozone by 2050?

context: Since the 1970s, an important focus of study has been <b5_0>the <a0_0>ozone layer<b5_0/><a0_0/> in the atmosphere above Antarctica. In <a2_0>1985<a2_0/>, three British scientists working on data they had gathered at Halley Station on the <a1_0>Brunt Ice Shelf<a1_0/> discovered the existence of <b6_0>a hole<b6_0/> in this layer. It was eventually determined that the destruction of the ozone was caused by <a3_0><b7_0>chlorofluorocarbons<b7_0/><a3_0/> (CFCs) emitted by human products. With the ban of <b8_0>CFCs<b8_0/> in the <a4_0>Montreal Protocol<a4_0/> of 1989, climate projections indicate that the <b9_0>ozone layer will return to 1980 levels<b9_0/> between 2050 and 2070.
